poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: They culled the individualists And clubbed the demonstrators; Real fear curbed the old intelligentsia. The train from Moscow to Vladivostok Took five minutes short of a week. A straight line from one to the other Would have gone down a steep cellar stair But they clung to the curved face of the earth The curd and the honey, the pasture and cud. Queues, as for the sacrament, shuffled and Curled on every public space of the Soviet Union.
